history.content:
Yes, you need 2 every semester. I've taken only a physics & a CS class (for techs) during a semester and I was fine. 

=====

The above answer isn't completely correct.

It is NOT required for you to take 2 CS classes every semester. This is just the general trend that most CS students do. You are totally welcome to take 1 class for 1 semester and then take 4 classes the next semester. It doesn't matter how complete the requirements - it just matters that you do complete them.

Yes, you need 2 every semester. I've taken only a physics & a CS class (for techs) during a semester and I was fine.

It is NOT required for you to take 2 CS classes every semester. This is just the general trend that most CS students do. You are totally welcome to take 1 class for 1 semester and then take 4 classes the next semester. It doesn't matter how complete the requirements - it just matters that you do complete them.

----

The above answer is for L&S students, who have no requirements on how many CS classes they take.

The original asker, based on the folders used, appears to be an EECS student, who do have an requirement of taking two technicals.

Yes, you need 2 every semester. I've taken only a physics & a CS class (for techs) during a semester and I was fine.

children.subject:
See my answer above - nothing happens if you can't.

All CS/EE classes count as techs and anything in this list below counts as a technical elective.

http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext

Vineet's link is the list of classes that satisfy the technical elective requirement for CS majors.

That is not the same as the list of classes that are considered technicals, which is answered @458.

I have no answer regarding your first question.

OP: Email me if you really can't find two tech courses to complete this semester. 


Vineet, please check major before posting answers.
Hey, I understand here that Vineet was "wrong" here but can we please have a more constructive discussion board here? We could always be more polite 🙂
Ok so what happens if I don't/can't? And also what department's count as techs?

history.content:
(Please do not post student answers unless sure you're correct)

Yes, if you are in EECS, 2 techs are required. Must be EECS, engineering, math, physics

children.subject:
@Nicole, strictly EECS, engineering, math, physics? Or can we petition for a Stats class to count, for example

And if yes, where/to whom do we petition that?

history.content:
I want to double check, do we need to have two techs a semester, every semester? Most CS classes are full right now, so I'm not sure how this would work.

If yes, what counts as a tech - is it only CS or do math, physics, stats, etc count as techs?
history.subject: Two techs/semester?
